t: Job Says He Has Become a Byword
“My*pn spirit is broken, my days are extinguished, The*ln grave is ready*i for me.
Surely*ln mockers are with me, And*ln my eye gazes on their provocation.
“Lay*ln down, now, a pledge for me with Yourself; Who*ln is there that will be my guarantor?
For*ln You have kept their heart from understanding, Therefore*ln You will not exalt them.*i
He*ln who informs against friends for a share of*i the*i spoil,*i The*ln eyes of his children also will languish.
“But*ln He has made me a byword of the people, And*ln I am one at whom men spit.
My*ln eye has also grown dim because of grief, And*ln all my members are as a shadow.
The*ln upright will be appalled at this, And*ln the innocent will stir up himself against the godless.
Nevertheless*ln the righteous will hold to his way, And*ln he who has clean hands will grow stronger and stronger.
But*ln come again all of you now, For*ln I do not find a wise man among you.
My*ln days are past, my plans are torn apart, Even*iln the wishes of my heart.
They*ln make night into day, saying,*i ‘The*ln light is near,’ in the presence of darkness.
If*ln I look for Sheol as my home, I*ln make my bed in the darkness;
If*ln I call to the pit, ‘You are my father’; To*ln the worm, ‘my mother and my sister’;
Where*ln now is my hope? And*ln who regards my hope?
Will*ln it go down with me to Sheol? Shall*ln we together go down into the dust?”
